communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Staff Counts
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

- The names and titles of all employees at the EPA's Office of Chemical Safety and Pollution Prevention as of January 20, 2025.
- The names and titles of all employees at the EPA's Office of Research and Development as of January 20, 2025.
- The names and titles of all employees at the EPA's Office of Chemical Safety and Pollution Prevention as of August 20, 2025.
- The names and titles of all employees at the EPA's Office of Research and Development as of August 20, 2025.
- The names and titles of all employees at the EPA's Office of Applied Science and Environmental Solutions as of August 20, 2025.

For all of the above requests, if data is not available for the precise date requested, please use the nearest date available and specify the date used to pull records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Meg Duff

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FY2023 FOIA Log (Department of Energy)

Sincerely,

Brandon Galbraith

title: SC DHEC Request, Septic System Records, 140 & 150 W. Main St. Pacolet, SC 29372

communications.subject: South Carolina Public Records Law Request: SC DHEC Request, Septic System Records, 140 & 150 W. Main St. Pacolet, SC 29372
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the South Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

As per South Carolina Freedom of Information Act (§ 30-4-10 et seq.), I am requesting copies of all records related to the onsite wastewater (septic) system serving the following properties in Pacolet, SC:

1. 140 W Main St. Pacolet, SC 29372 – Parcel # 3-33-03-009.03

2. 150 West Main St. Pacolet, SC 29372  Main Building – Parcel # 3-33-03-009.04

3. 150 West Main St., Suite B (metal building), Pacolet, SC 29372  – Parcel # 3-33-03-009.04

Please include for each property:

- Any permits, approvals, or inspections conducted by SC DHEC for the septic system(s) serving these addresses.

- Any “Permit to Construct” or “Approval for Use” documents for the system(s).

- Any records showing septic system design, capacity, and its intended use.

- Any records approving additional plumbing fixtures or changes in use that would increase wastewater flow.

If the septic system serving these addresses is a shared system, please also provide all records for the shared system as a whole.

If no records exist for any of the above addresses or for the shared system, please provide written confirmation of that fact.

If any portion of this request is denied, please cite the specific exemption under FOIA that justifies the refusal.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Greg Samsa

communications.subject: Re: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Beverage Agreements
communications.communication:
Kelly North,
Thank you for your public records request. We are reviewing your request
and will respond to you promptly. The time for production of records varies
based on the number of records you have requested, the location of the
records, the medium in which the records are stored, the need for legal
review, and the need to redact non-public information. Please let me know
if you have any questions.

~Sheila


<http://miamioh.edu/>




Sheila Theobald

Administrative Associate

*Miami University*

Office of the President

501 E. High Street

210 Roudebush Hall

Oxford, OH 45056

O: 513-529-6734 | MiamiOH.edu

communications.subject: RE: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Beverage Agreements
communications.communication:
Dear Kelly,



Thank you for writing to Joliet Junior College with your Freedom of Information Act request pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. On August 21, 2025, you made a request for the following information:



  *   Agreements related to the beverage pouring, distribution, sales or marketing rights for campus, athletics venues or facilities.


Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, we will respond within five business days of the receipt of your request. We will provide responsive documentation on or before August 28, 2025.





Sincerely,


Lisa M. Johnson
Administrative Assistant
Risk Management and Compliance
Joliet Junior College
J-2020
(815) 280-2921
lisa.johnson@jjc.edu<mailto:lisa.johnson@jjc.edu>
https://jjc.edu<https://jjc.edu/>

communications.subject: RE: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Beverage Agreements
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

Thank you for your public records request, by this communication we acknowledge receipt.


Cleveland State University
Office of General Counsel
Phone No.:  (216) 687-3543
     Fax No.:  (216) 687-3736

[cid:image001.png@01DC12B0.4B0A9100]


**********UNIVERSITY LEGAL COUNSEL - CONFIDENTIAL COMMUNICATION**********
This e-mail and any files transmitted with it are confidential and are intended solely for the use of the individual or entity to whom it is addressed.  This communication may contain material protected by attorney-client privilege.  If you are not the intended recipient or the person responsible for delivering the e-mail to the intended recipient, be advised that you have received this e-mail in error and that any use, dissemination, forwarding, printing, or copying of this e-mail and any file attachments is strictly prohibited.  If you have received this e-mail in error, please immediately notify the Office of the University Legal Counsel by telephone at 216/687-3543 or by reply mail to the sender.  You must destroy the original transmission and its contents.

U.S. Treasury Circular 230 Disclosure: Any tax advice contained in this email is not intended or written to be used, and cannot be used, for the purpose of avoiding penalties under the Internal Revenue Code or promoting, marketing or recommending to another party any transaction or matter addressed herein.

communications.subject: RE: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Beverage Agreements
communications.communication:
Greetings,

This correspondence is to acknowledge that we are in receipt of your public records request, received below.  We are in the process of identifying the responsive materials related to your request.  Once we have completed this process, we will notify you if there are associated costs as permitted under the Florida public records laws, section 119.07, Florida Statutes, for which you may be responsible for prior to release of the records.

In the interim, please feel free to contact me with any questions.

Cordially,

Sandy Zablackas | Legal Assistant III
Office of the General Counsel
fgcu.edu/generalcounsel<https://www.fgcu.edu/generalcounsel/>


[cid:image001.jpg@01DC12AE.DB8B4820]

Florida Gulf Coast University
10501 FGCU Blvd. S., Fort Myers, FL 33965  |  fgcu.edu<http://www.fgcu.edu/>
P: 239.745.4427 | E: szablackas@fgcu.edu<mailto:szablackas@fgcu.edu>
CONFIDENTIALITY STATEMENT
This email may contain information that is privileged, confidential, or otherwise exempt from disclosure under applicable law and is intended only for the use of the addressee(s). If you are not the addressee and it appears from the context or otherwise that you have received this email in error, please advise me immediately by reply email, keep the contents confidential, and immediately delete the message and any attachments from your system. Any review, dissemination, distribution or duplication of this communication is strictly prohibited.

communications.subject: Alabama Open Records Law Request: Renee Bergeron Case File
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Alabama Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting the investigative case file related to the death of Renee / Renée Bergeron on 11/12/1993. Records may include, but are not limited to:

Case file index
Case synopsis
Incident reports
Supplemental reports
Autopsy report/coroner's verdict/medical examiner findings
Any photographs or visual evidence related to the case, including of the victim
Scene photographs
Scene diagrams
Arrest records and/or police blotter records, if any, associated with the case
Any records of communication or coordination with other law enforcement agencies
ViCAP summary report
CAD event sheet
Media communications, including press releases 
Witness interviews and statements
Audio and/or video recorded statements
Lead sheets
Search warrants and/or complaints for search warrants
Investigative notes
Evidence logs

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

André Natta, a citizen of Alabama, in coordination with Courteney Stuart.

title: Metropolitan Transportation Authority/New York City Transit’s “second safety risk assessment (SRA)” submitted to FTA on January 27, 2025

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Metropolitan Transportation Authority/New York City Transit’s “second safety risk assessment (SRA)” submitted to FTA on January 27, 2025
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The “second safety risk assessment (SRA) submitted to the Federal Transit Administration by the Metropolitan Transportation Authority/New York City Transit” on or around January 27, 2025, in response to Required Action FTA-24-6-001-1 from Special Directive (SD) 24-6. 

For reference, the record is  described in a letter of August 19, 2025 from FTA Associate Administrator Joe DeLorenzo to Demetrius Crichlow, President, New York City Transit Authority, with subject “Bringing NYCT into Compliance with Required Action FTA-24-6-0001-1”, posted by the FTA at the following URL: https://www.transit.dot.gov/sites/fta.dot.gov/files/2025-08/Letter-from-FTA-to-MTA-New-York%E2%80%93August-2025.pdf

That same letter describes the  request as “the Metropolitan Transit [sic] Authority (MTA) New  York City Transit Authority’s (NYCT) second safety risk assessment (SRA), which NYCT submitted on January 27, 2025, in response to Required Action FTA-24-6-001-1 from Special  Directive (SD) 24-6.”

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Noah McClain

Dear FOIA Officer:

You are receiving this correspondence as a request under the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. subsection 552. I am requesting the following:

Copies of all Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) records, documents, and communications responsive to John Clifford Ellsworth, aka Clifford J. Ellsworth, aka John Jaymes, aka John James, aka Thomas Fiorella (April 04 1946 — December 21, 1994; SSN 132-34-2550).

Mr. Ellsworth was a criminal forger and associate of the Gambino crime family. Mr. Ellsworth was connected to a business, the International Children's Appeal (ICA), that appeared in a 20/20 segment, "In the Name of Charity", on July 19, 1979, for engaging in financial fraud and money laundering. The business targeted a United Nations charity, UNICEF, as part of a year-long fundraising event, the International Year of the Child.

In the 20/20 segment, it was revealed Mr. Ellsworth maintained connections to the Gambino crime family, and had intended to use the ICA to help a Gambino captain, James Vincent Eppolito, launder money obtained through drug trafficking. Reporters working for 20/20 stated Mr. Ellsworth both leading up to and during this period worked as a government informant, naming the Drug Enforcement Administration as one of the agencies that he worked for.

Documents disclosed during  subsequent court case, United States of America v. Frank Cosolito and Ralph Russo (Crim. No. 79-436-C), revealed Mr. Ellsworth also worked for the Department of Justice and the Internal Revenue Service. A judgment from that case can be found here: https://law.justia.com/cases/federal/district-courts/FSupp/488/531/1400252/

In response to press coverage of his exploits, Mr. Ellsworth stated to a journalist working for the Washington Post that he "once took a fall" for the CIA, indicating that he maintained some sort of association with the agency. A copy of the Washingtonian Post article can be found here: https://www.washingtonpost.com/archive/lifestyle/1979/12/02/the-mysterious-connections-of-john-ellsworth/6044c556-88b1-480c-b6ce-cc24043a0805/

The CIA appears to have maintained some sort of interest in Mr. Ellsworth, as a copy of the Washington Post article can be found in its CREST system: https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/CIA-RDP80B01554R003300190041-5.pdf

The article can be found on pages 2 and 5 of the linked document. These pages include the following underlined sections:

1. "One partner with alleged American CIA connections who actually dealt in arms, with a 'catalog' that included a 'laser gun that can cut a tree in half.'"

2. "Ellsworth laughs when told that many of his former employees at ICA are convinced that he himself is in no danger because it is widely believed in certain criminal circles that he 'works for the CIA.'"

As such, I am requesting the CIA release all records not already released about Mr. Ellsworth. You may exclude the previously released Washington Post article from this request.

There is a compelling public interest in releasing this information: between 1977 and 1979, Mr. Ellsworth attended events at the White House and hosted a luncheon for First Lady Rosalynn Carter. Any association with a sitting president, or the CIA, for that matter, would be a subject of public concern.

This information has already been requested at least once in the past: FOIA request F-2018-01557, for information pertaining to "JOHN CLIFFORD ELLSWORTH [1946-1994]", was opened on May 9, 2018, per the CIA's 2018 FOIA case log.

I am asking you waive any fees associated with this request. I am a member of the news media. My bylines, which include Unicorn Riot, Covert Action Magazine, and the Geopolitical Economy Report, can be found in both print and electronic publications, and I am sending this request in coordination with Muckrock, an award-winning and nationally-recognized news organization. Please take note of the Office of Management and Budget guidelines published March 27, 1987 (52 FR 10012) that include electronic publications and other nontraditional publishers as representatives of the news media.

In the event that there are fees, I am willing to pay up to $100. Please advise if fees will exceed this amount so I might make an arrangement for requesting the records. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

I look forward to your response within 20 working days, as the statute requires. If access to the records I am requesting will take longer, please contact me with information about when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records.

If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.

Sincerely,

Robert Skvarla, Jr.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI HMC 8.21.25
communications.communication:
Dear FOIA Officer:

You are receiving this correspondence as a request under the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. subsection 552. I am requesting the following:

Copies of all Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) records, documents, and communications responsive to Dr. Harris Marshall Chadwell (July 20, 1898 — June 3, 1980).

Dr. Chadwell served as the Division Chief for Divisions 11 and 19 at the National Defense Research Committee (NDRC) and later the Office of Scientific Research and Development (OSRD) between 1940 and 1946; Associate Director of the Rockefeller Foundation's Natural Sciences Division between 1947 and 1948; Deputy Manager of the New York office of the Atomic Energy Commission (AEC) between 1949 and 1950; and Assistance Director of the Office of Scientific Intelligence at the Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) between 1950 and 1955.

Three of the these agencies—the NDRC/OSRD, AEC, and CIA—would have required Internal Security checks by the FBI to clear Dr. Chadwell for government service. As such, I am requesting all FBI records generated during these reviews and any other records created at any point related to Dr. Chadwell.

Dr. Chadwell is a figure of ongoing public interest. While working for the CIA, Dr. Chadwell was formative in the agency convening the Robertson Panel, a scientific committee established in 1952 to review the United States Air Force's research into unidentified flying objects; he lobbied Director of Central Intelligence Walter Bedell Smith to create the group, worked with panel head Howard P. Robertson to select its members,  and served as an associate member and agency liaison to the group. Dr. Chadwell's involvement with the Robertson Panel is public knowledge thanks to disclosure by the CIA in its academic journal, "Studies in Intelligence", in November 1997. A copy of the article by Gerald Haines, "CIA's Role in the Study of UFOs, 1947-90", can be found here: https://www.cia.gov/resources/csi/static/cia-role-study-UFOs.pdf

Proof of death is not required as Dr. Chadwell's date of birth was over 100 years ago.

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Records System, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records related to all above referenced committees, agencies, and organizations.

I am asking you waive any fees associated with this request. I am a member of the news media. My bylines, which include Unicorn Riot, Covert Action Magazine, and the Geopolitical Economy Report, can be found in both print and electronic publications, and I am sending this request in coordination with Muckrock, an award-winning and nationally-recognized news organization. Please take note of the Office of Management and Budget guidelines published March 27, 1987 (52 FR 10012) that include electronic publications and other nontraditional publishers as representatives of the news media.

A fee waiver would be appropriate for the reasons stated above.

In the event that there are fees, I am willing to pay up to $100. Please advise if fees will exceed this amount so I might make an arrangement for requesting the records. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

I look forward to your response within 20 working days, as the statute requires. If access to the records I am requesting will take longer, please contact me with information about when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records.

If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.

Sincerely,

Robert Skvarla, Jr.

Attachments:

https://cdn.muckrock.com/outbound_composer_attachments/miriamcb/161296/to_from_jroberts4_cps.edu_responsive_email_log_REDACTED_RELEASE_Highlights.xlsx
Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fchicago-public-schools-3121%252Femail-contents-jason-roberts-foreman-191655%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAATZ9nyQeqyLof_ukSA-_sVM-A%3A1uovbD%3AnkaYRQJsmDUZDy5aNP0U25cj7yvwDwuiU21PpjZEZZs 
 
Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center. 

Track the issue status and respond at: https://cps.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP//_rs/RequestEdit.aspx?rid=18100

Dear Ms. North, 
This is in final response to your Sunshine Law request, which has been assigned tracking #R013071-082025. To view your request, please follow the link below to the online portal and select My Records Center. 
Attached are the responsive contracts for the University's St. Louis and Kansas City campuses.  The beverage services for the athletics facilities on the Columbia campus are contracted by an third party company. 
Because the cost of gathering these records is de minimis, there will be no charge for document search and duplication. 
Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions. 
Sincerely, 
Paula Barrett 
Custodian of Records 
University of Missouri System 
1100 Carrie Francke Dr., Ste. 227 
Columbia, MO  65211 
Ph: 573-882-1998 
barrettp@umsystem.edu 
To view and monitor the progress of this request, please log into the Public Records System Site. (https://u8387795.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.PYICgxP3kfgZjR-2B4e9nPlPpiMOyx7jfY4GvYuTY1t3fGsVHQYLrPx9-2BtKoGT0pkHl4tTIWZafPusdXu2LJ8B3A-3D-3DMk8U_UCmT37qcEwC6pKZel9Nob0DQYVKI4zDduTvkaHdkWzp2g5rqu9uRgrxoIKeM5MvKvGLprhm0tXVhQaszk76PCZ6C3OiC3g1MDq3Sdc7DzSpUorsgKVHKE-2BTfoGiFY7kn9NNsEiqeolCY61XstSUkyuW1FNPHgPSs-2F9I-2FanLHx87xJz92-2BNSAQGoytDCewoRoSwMg-2BJvWzIvq5OWSI2RCmIEGSlI3PQ-2BB-2F8QBIY8y64SE6BU7Bd0C1Mx9QYa1wJP1E4uvaYLRnFSeMGe-2FlXSR6unqPymH6WqPXGgVWdCWdsXlADicQhIjBQwvuQP8ouaaLr8-2By2-2FBbtryc-2FfooOwfsiFnIQ5-2FELNaFYEz-2BXSUGPI-2BaaY-2Bxg9yEiyQpZ9Y8e7Pl1rlTIsyXwBXwDdAgbEaxA-3D-3D)

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Beverage Agreements
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Agreements related to the beverage pouring, distribution, sales or marketing rights for campus, athletics venues or facilities.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kelly North

communications.subject: Re: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Beverage Agreements
communications.communication:
Good morning,

I am writing to confirm receipt of your request under Michigan's Freedom of
Information Act (FOIA) by Grand Rapids Community College. We will provide a
response within five (5) business days.

Thank you,

*Jessica Blandford*
Assistant to the General Counsel

Grand Rapids Community College
ph. 616.234.3134
jessicablandford@grcc.edu
Bostwick Office Suites

title: Library Contract Request: HeinOnline (Honolulu Community College (honolulu, Hi))

communications.subject: Hawaii Uniform Information Practices Act Request: Library Contract Request: HeinOnline (Honolulu Community College (honolulu, Hi))
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Hawaii Uniform Information Practices Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) The most recent contract, governing, base, or master license agreement with William S. Hein & Co. relating to the licensing of the “HeinOnline” database;
2) All related terms and conditions, terms of service, amendments, addenda, appendices, attachments, product terms, MOUs, MOAs, data processing agreements, and/or letters of intent; and
3) All financial documents or records of financial transactions, exchanges or obligations related to the contractual relations with William S. Hein & Co. for the “HeinOnline” database. 

Please do not limit your search to strictly direct agreements or renewals between the institution and William S. Hein & Co., but include any agreements and related documentation through consortia such as the Hawai’i Library Consortium, the Greater Western Library Alliance (GWLA), or Lyrasis.

Responsive materials include all contracts, agreements, amendments, appendices, invoices, and any other documents listed above that incorporate language governing terms of use of the “HeinOnline” database.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ellen Dubinsky
